The Earth revolves around the sun in an elliptical orbit.
Water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius and boils at 100 degrees Celsius.

Photosynthesis is the process plants use to convert light into energy.

A circle is a closed curve where all points are the same distance from the center.
The chemical symbol for water is H2O.
The element with the symbol O is Oxygen.
DNA is the molecule that carries genetic information.
The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299792458 meters per second.
The scientific method involves observation hypothesis experiment and analysis.
The basic unit of heredity is the gene.
The planet Mars is often called the "Red Planet."
The moon is the Earth's natural satellite.
A year has approximately 365 days.
A day is equal to 24 hours.
There are twelve months in a year.
The sun is a star.

The Earth’s atmosphere is mainly composed of nitrogen and oxygen.

Earthquakes are sudden movements of the Earth’s crust.
The process by which rocks are broken down is called weathering.
The largest desert in the world is the Antarctic desert.
The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system.
The United Nations is an international organization.
Democracy is a system of government where power is held by the people.
A republic is a form of government with an elected president as head of state.
Capitalism is an economic system based on private ownership and free markets.
Communism is an economic and political system aiming for a classless society.
The Renaissance was a period of great cultural and artistic change in Europe.
The Industrial Revolution led to significant changes in manufacturing and production.
World War I occurred from 1914 to 1918.
World War II occurred from 1939 to 1945.
The internet is a global network of interconnected computers.
The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell.
The computer was developed in the 20th century.
The scientific name for humans is Homo sapiens.
A mammal is a warm-blooded vertebrate that nourishes it's young with milk.
A bird is a warm-blooded vertebrate with feathers.
A fish is a cold-blooded vertebrate that lives in water and uses gills to breathe.
Reptiles are cold-blooded vertebrates that lay eggs.
Amphibians are cold-blooded vertebrates that live in both water and on land.
The largest animal is the Blue Whale.
The smallest mammal is the Bumblebee Bat.
The highest waterfall in the world is Angel Falls.
The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world.
The Nile is the longest river in Africa.
The United Kingdom consists of England Scotland Wales and Northern Ireland.
The Taj Mahal is a famous mausoleum in India.
The Great Wall of China is a major historical landmark.
The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark in Paris.
The Statue of Liberty is located in New York City.
The Mona Lisa is a famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci.
The periodic table organizes chemical elements based on their atomic structure.
The atom is the smallest unit of ordinary matter.
Cells are the basic structural functional and biological unit of all known living organisms.
Bacteria are single-celled microorganisms.
Viruses are infectious agents that can replicate inside living cells.
Vaccines are used to prevent diseases by stimulating the body's immune system.
Antibiotics are medicines that fight bacterial infections.
The nervous system transmit's signals between the brain and the rest of the body.
The endocrine system produces hormones that regulate body functions.
The digestive system breaks down food for energy.
The respiratory system allows the intake of oxygen and expulsion of carbon dioxide.
The circulatory system transports blood throughout the body.
The concept of time can be measured by using clocks.
The cardinal directions are North South East and West.
Longitude and latitude are used to specify locations on Earth.
The four seasons are spring summer autumn and winter.
A light year is a measure of distance not time.
A kilometer is 1000 meters in distance.
A liter is a common measurement of liquid volume.
Kilograms are used to measure mass.
The speed of sound in air is about 343 meters per second.
Electromagnetism is one of the fundamental forces of nature.
An object in motion tends to stay in motion unless acted upon by a force.
Energy cannot be created or destroyed only converted from one form to another.
Matter is anything that has mass and takes up space.
A good is a tangible item while a service is not.
A trade occurs between two or more parties.
Inflation happens when general price levels are increased.
Depression is an economic recession that happens during longer periods.
The currency of Japan is the Japanese Yen.
The population of India is the second largest in the world.
The largest planet in our solar system is Jupiter.
There are eight planets in our solar system including Earth.
Constellations are group of stars that form a recognizable shape.
A meteoroid becomes a meteor when it enters earth's atmosphere and it also appears as a light.
An eclipse occurs when one celestial body blocks the light from another.
The Big Bang theory is the leading theory about how the universe began.
The ancient Egyptian civilization was located along the Nile River.
The Roman Empire was one of the most powerful civilizations in history.
The concept of zero was developed in India.

The field of Psychology studies the mind and behavior.
Sociology studies social relationships and interactions.
Anthropology studies human societies and cultures.

Political science studies the theory and practice of politics and government.

Music is an art form using sound and rhythm.
Painting is an art form using color and images.
Sculpture is an art form using three-dimensional shapes.
Theater is an art form using performance and storytelling.
Photography is an art form using captured light.
Film or movie-making is a collaborative form of visual storytelling.
The Golden Ratio is a mathematical proportion frequently used in art and design.
Symmetry is a balance across a dividing line or around a center.
Perspective is the way objects appear to the eye based on their spatial attributes.
Rhythm is a pattern of strong and weak elements.
A melody is a sequence of musical notes.
Harmony is the combination of musical notes that sound pleasing together.
Tempo is the speed or pace of a musical piece.
Classical music generally refers to music from the Baroque Classical and Romantic periods.
Jazz is a genre of music characterized by improvisation and syncopation.
Pop music is a popular genre of contemporary music.
Rock music is a genre of music characterized by electric guitars and drums.
Hip-hop is a genre of music characterized by rapping and beats.
Bluegrass is a genre of American folk music with acoustic instruments.
A metaphor is a figure of speech that directly equates two things.
A simile is a figure of speech that compares two things using 'like' or 'as.'
Personification is a figure of speech where inanimate objects have human qualities.
Hyperbole is an exaggeration for emphasis.
An idiom is a phrase with a figurative meaning that's different from it's literal meaning.
A paradox is a statement that appears self-contradictory but contains truth.
Alliteration is the repetition of consonant sounds at the beginning of words.
Onomatopoeia is a word that imitates a sound.
A poem is a creative piece of writing that expresses ideas using language and meter.
A novel is a long fictional story.
A short story is a brief fictional narrative.
Drama is a written form intended to be performed as theatre.
Mythology is the study of myths or traditional stories that explain a culture's world.
Folklore consists of traditional beliefs and customs of a community.
The concept of time varies across cultures and history.
Culture refers to the set of shared attitudes values goals and practices that characterize an institution organization or group.
Ethnocentrism is judging other cultures solely by the values of one's own culture.
Cultural relativism is understanding a culture in it's own terms without judgement.
Monotheism is the belief in one God.
Polytheism is the belief in many gods.
Atheism is the belief that there is no God or gods.
Agnosticism is the view that the existence of God or gods is unknown or unknowable.
Buddhism originated in India and focuses on achieving enlightenment.
Christianity is a religion based on the teachings of Jesus Christ.
Hinduism is an ancient religion originating in India.
Islam is a religion based on the teachings of the prophet Muhammad.
Judaism is a religion practiced by the Jewish people.
Sikhism is a religion originating in India that focuses on service and equality.
Philosophy is the study of fundamental questions about existence knowledge values reason mind and language.
Logic is the study of valid reasoning.
Ethics is the study of moral principles and values.
Aesthetics is the study of beauty and art.
Epistemology is the study of knowledge and belief.
Metaphysics is the study of the fundamental nature of reality.
The concept of consciousness is explored in neuroscience and philosophy.
Quantum physics studies the behavior of matter and energy at the atomic and subatomic levels.
Relativity is the study of space time gravity and motion.
Thermodynamics studies the behavior of energy and it's relation to heat and work.
Evolution is the change in the inherited characteristics of biological populations over successive generations.
The concept of entropy relates to the level of disorder or randomness in a system.
The carbon cycle is the flow of carbon through the atmosphere oceans and land.
Climate change is the significant and lasting change in global weather patterns.
Biodiversity refers to the variety of life on Earth.
Sustainability aims to meet the needs of the present without compromising future generations' ability to meet their own needs.
A renewable resource can be naturally replenished such as wind and solar power.
A non-renewable resource is finite like fossil fuels.
Globalization is the increasing interconnectedness of countries through trade travel and communication.
Urbanization is the growth of cities.
Migration is the movement of people from one place to another.
Artificial intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence in machines.
Machine learning allows computers to learn from data without explicit programming.
Data science is a field that extracts knowledge and insights from data.
The blockchain is a technology for creating secure and transparent records of transactions.
Cryptocurrency is a digital or virtual currency secured by cryptography.
Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting computer systems and networks from digital attacks.
Genetics studies the inheritance and variation of trait's in organisms.
The study of Astronomy is based on celestial objects space and the universe.
Medicine is the branch of health care focused on prevention and treatment of illnesses.
Engineering uses scientific and mathematical principles to design and build structures and systems.
Architecture is the design of buildings and other physical structures.
Agriculture is the practice of farming to produce food and other products.
The legal system includes rules laws and judicial processes.
Bureaucracy refers to the administrative system in government or large organization.
Diplomacy is the management of international relations.
Nationalism is a strong identification with a nation and it's culture.
Patriotism is love for one's country.
A constitution is a basic law of the land or state.
A treaty is a formal agreement between countries or states.
The concept of human rights refers to basic freedoms and rights all people should have.

The sky is often a gradient of blue becoming lighter towards the horizon.
Grass is typically green due to the presence of chlorophyll.
Sunlight contains all colors of the rainbow visible when it passes through a prism or creates a rainbow in rain.
Water reflects light often appearing blue in large bodies like oceans and lakes.
The Earth rotates on it's axis causing day and night.
The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
Trees produce oxygen which is essential for human breathing.
Bees pollinate flowers enabling the growth of fruit's and vegetables.
Mountains are large landforms rising above the surrounding terrain.
A desert is an area that receives very little rainfall.
The moon reflects sunlight illuminating the night sky.
A compass points north which helps with navigation.
The planet Earth is primarily covered by water.
The continents are large landmasses separated by oceans.
Gravity pulls objects towards the Earth's center.
The human body has five main senses: sight hearing smell taste and touch.
Birds often migrate to warmer climates in the winter months.
Volcanoes are openings in the Earth's crust that release molten rock and gas.
A rainforest is a dense forest with high rainfall and biodiversity.
A river is a flowing body of water often emptying into an ocean or lake.
Sand is made from tiny particles of weathered rocks.
Snow is frozen precipitation that falls as white flakes.
Ice is the solid form of water typically appearing clear or whitish.
The wind is caused by differences in air pressure.
Fog is a cloud that forms near the ground.
A rainbow appears when sunlight is refracted and reflected by water droplets in the air.
The colors of a rainbow always appear in the same order: red orange yellow green blue indigo and violet.
A clock measures time using hours minutes and seconds.
A calendar tracks the days weeks and months of a year.
Different cultures have their own unique traditions and customs.
A thermometer measures the temperature of things often in degrees Celsius or Fahrenheit.
A barometer measures atmospheric pressure which is related to the weather.
An animal breathes typically using lungs or gills.
A plant gets it's nutrients from the soil and sun using the process of photosynthesis.
A circle is a two-dimensional shape where every point on the edge is the same distance from it's center.
A square is a four-sided shape with all sides equal in length and all angles at 90 degrees.
A triangle is a three-sided shape.
An oval is a closed curve resembling an egg.
A map is a representation of a particular area often to scale.
The equator is an imaginary line dividing the Earth into the Northern and Southern hemispheres.
The North and South poles are the furthest points of the Earth from the equator.
A hurricane is a powerful tropical storm with strong winds and heavy rainfall.
A tornado is a violently rotating column of air touching both the ground and a cloud.
An earthquake is a sudden shaking of the ground due to tectonic movement.
Light travels very fast in a straight line and can be refracted by a lens.
Sound travels in waves through the air or a medium.
Different types of energy include kinetic potential thermal and electrical.
A magnet is an object that attracts or repels other objects usually made of metal.
An atom is the smallest basic unit of matter.
Molecules are formed by two or more atoms bonded together.
Chemical reactions involve the rearrangement of atoms and molecules.
All matter has mass and occupies space.
Newton's laws of motion describe how forces affect the movement of objects.
The speed of light is a universal constant and is approximately 300000 kilometers per second.
Photosynthesis is the process where plants convert light energy into chemical energy using water and carbon dioxide.
Respiration is the process by which organisms convert food into energy often using oxygen.
Evolution is the process of gradual change in organisms over many generations.
DNA is the molecule that carries genetic information and that dictates trait's.
Genes are specific sequences of DNA that influence inherited trait's.
Cell is the basic structural and functional unit of life.
Organism is any individual form of life like plant animal bacteria or single cell.
Ecology studies the interactions between organisms and their environment.
A fossil is the preserved remains or traces of ancient life.
Climate is the long-term weather pattern in a specific region.
Weather is the state of the atmosphere at a particular place and time encompassing things such as rain wind and temperature.
A tide is the regular rising and falling of the sea level mostly caused by the gravitational pull of the moon and sun on Earth.
An asteroid is a small rocky object orbiting the sun usually between Mars and Jupiter.
A comet is an icy body that releases gas and dust creating a tail as it approaches the sun.
A galaxy is a large collection of stars gas dust and dark matter bound together by gravity our own one being the Milky Way.
Stars are massive luminous spheres of plasma held together by their own gravity constantly generating and releasing large amounts of energy.
Planets are celestial bodies that orbit a star.
The universe encompasses everything that exists: space time energy and matter it contains all galaxies stars planets and other celestial bodies.
Constellations are patterns of stars that form recognizable figures in the night sky.
The concept of time involves past present and future.
Every living creature and every structure has at least three dimensions: Length Width and Height.
Light is a form of electromagnetic radiation and comes in varying wavelengths that correspond to different colors in the visible spectrum.
A shadow is a dark area formed by something blocking light.
A vacuum is an absence of matter and in outer space you have that condition to it's absolute limit.
A proton a neutron and an electron form the basic constituents of the very thing we know as matter.
The mass of a proton is roughly the same as a neutron which is more than 1800 times the mass of an electron.
Electrons orbit the nucleus of atoms whereas the nucleus holds together the protons and neutrons in it's structure.
The pH scale measure acidity and alkalinity where zero is super acidic and 14 is super alkaline where 7 is considered neutral like water.
A liquid has a constant volume but can take on the shape of the vessel it's inside it is always moving at a microscopic level even when stationary.
A solid has a fixed shape and volume but some solids can deform at very large stress values whilst others may simply fracture instead.
A gas has no fixed volume nor fixed shape and can expand and contract filling any vessel completely and will always flow.
